channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden says he would halt additional weapons shipments if Israel invades Rafah
item.description: The president's comments to CNN follow news that one shipment of bombs is already on hold out of concern about the impact on civilian lives.
item.content:encoded:
The president's comments to CNN follow news that one shipment of bombs is already on hold out of concern about the impact on civilian lives.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Online Scams are a Worldwide Problem and Scammers May Also Be Victims
item.description: Scams that target people via direct message and texts in an effort to steal money have become pervasive. But the scammer on the other end of the communication might be a victim too, in a human-trafficking scheme. We hear the story of one such victim.
item.content:encoded: Scams that target people via direct message and texts in an effort to steal money have become pervasive. But the scammer on the other end of the communication might be a victim too, in a human-trafficking scheme. We hear the story of one such victim.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Bid to oust Speaker Johnson fails but GOP turmoil remains
item.description: The House voted overwhelmingly to set aside a motion by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., to remove Johnson as speaker
item.content:encoded:
The House voted overwhelmingly to set aside a motion by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., to remove Johnson as speaker

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Republicans and K-12 school leaders clash over handling of antisemitism
item.description: Republicans tried for the kind of headline moments they've scored in similar hearings with elite college presidents. But the testimony from K-12 public school leaders offered few surprises.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans tried for the kind of headline moments they've scored in similar hearings with elite college presidents. But the testimony from K-12 public school leaders offered few surprises.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Biden is tweaking an asylum rule to speed up deportation for some migrants
item.description: President Biden had said he wanted the power to effectively "shut down the border" when migration numbers surge. But this rule is an incremental shift.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden had said he wanted the power to effectively "shut down the border" when migration numbers surge. But this rule is an incremental shift.

(Image credit: Veronica G. Cardenas)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Oil industry could help the Biden administration tap 'invisible' green energy
item.description: The White House wants a twenty-fold increase in geothermal energy production to fight climate change and it's counting on the oil and gas industry for help.
item.content:encoded:
The White House wants a twenty-fold increase in geothermal energy production to fight climate change and it's counting on the oil and gas industry for help.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Indonesia's next president has a complicated history with the U.S.
item.description: President-elect Prabowo Subianto was once banned by the U.S. for rights violations. But the U.S. earlier gave him military training. How will both countries deal with each other once he takes office?
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Prabowo Subianto was once banned by the U.S. for rights violations. But the U.S. earlier gave him military training. How will both countries deal with each other once he takes office?

(Image credit: Achmad Ibrahim)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Body of the final Baltimore bridge collapse victim recovered in river, officials say
item.description: The Baltimore County Police Department confirmed the identity of the sixth victim, 37-year-old José Mynor López, after salvage teams located his body Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
The Baltimore County Police Department confirmed the identity of the sixth victim, 37-year-old José Mynor López, after salvage teams located his body Tuesday.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: A Swiss Army Knife without the knife: Victorinox to offer bladeless products
item.description: Some governments have been cracking down on the knives people can carry in public as crime has increased. Victorinox said any bladeless offerings wouldn't replace its selection of Swiss Army Knives.
item.content:encoded:
Some governments have been cracking down on the knives people can carry in public as crime has increased. Victorinox said any bladeless offerings wouldn't replace its selection of Swiss Army Knives.

(Image credit: Harold Cunningham)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'Black Twitter' docuseries celebrates the online community with real-world impact
item.description: When it comes to Black Twitter, filmmaker Prentice Penny says "no one is above being joked on." His Hulu docuseries charts the voices and movements that made it a force in politics and culture.
item.content:encoded: When it comes to Black Twitter, filmmaker Prentice Penny says "no one is above being joked on." His Hulu docuseries charts the voices and movements that made it a force in politics and culture.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley
